page.title: 13Thatched Cottage
page.content: In 1955 the quiet derelict Thatched Cottage which is situated in the heart of the countryside was bought by Mr and Mrs Bailey.The price was as low as two thousand pounds.As it was so empty, the birds had called it their home.The two acres of overgrown land needed alot of care and hard work to it. When the house was first bought by the family (as they had two children as well) it only had two upstairs rooms and only two downstairs rooms.But one of their sons became an architect,so in later times they had some more downstairs rooms built on.The original two downstairs rooms were a kitchen which had very thick beams and was very low down.The other original downstairs room was a living room there was a very big fire place.It even had a little seat inside
